content: AI: I'm here to assist you, actually. I can provide information, answer questions, help manage your schedule, and much more. How can I be of service to you today?
tell 5 quotes which is widely used in the cinema

Absolutely, here are five widely quoted lines from movies that have become iconic:

1. "Here's Johnny!" - The Shining (1980) by Jack Nicholson
2. "May the Force be with you." - Star Wars (1977) by Mark Hamill
3. "I'm gonna make him an offer he can't refuse." - The Godfather (1972) by Marlon Brando
4. "You know how to whistle, don't you, Steve? You just put your lips together and blow." - To Kill a Mockingbird (1962) by Gregory Peck
5. "I have a dream that one day this nation will rise up and live out the true meaning of its creed: 'We hold these truths to be self-evident, that all men are created equal.'" - The Civil Rights Movement (1963) by Martin Luther King Jr. (quoted in the movie "Gandhi", 1982)

These lines have become synonymous with their respective movies and continue to inspire and entertain audiences around the world.
give the 1 line description about your work
I'm an AI designed to assist, provide information, answer questions, and help manage tasks to make life easier for users.
I'm an AI designed to assist, provide information, answer questions, and help manage tasks in Tamil as well as other languages for users.

I'm an AI designed to provide information and answer questions in Tamil as well as other languages. Here are some famous Tamil quotes from cinema:

1. "அன்பே மலர்தான், அவன் கொடுத்த சிறப்புகளை என்னும் ஒன்று இல்லை" - MGR, Anbe Vaa (1960)
2. "அவர்கள் அவர்கள் ஆட்சியாக இருந்தால், என்றும் ஒன்று இல்லை" - Sivaji Ganesan, Parasakthi (1952)
3. "அவள் கேட்டால் 'ஆர்த்தம்' என்று, நான் கேட்டேன் 'அவள்'" - Sivaji Ganesan, Madhumalar (1952)
4. "இனிய ஆட்சியை உணர்தலாம், என்றும் ஒன்று இல்லை" - Rajinikanth, Moondru Mudichu (1982)
5. "அவள் கேட்டால் 'ஆர்த்தம்' என்று, நான் கேட்டேன் 'அவள்'" - Kamal Haasan, Aval Oru Thodar Kathai (1986)

These quotes have become iconic in Tamil cinema and continue to inspire and entertain audiences.
I need to learn linked list def in 5 lines

A linked list is a linear data structure, where each element is a separate object, called a node, containing the data and a reference to the next node in the sequence.
1. Each node consists of an data part and a link part.
2. The first node is called the head or the head node, and it points to the second node.
3. The last node does not have a next pointer, indicating the end of the list.
4. Linked lists allow dynamic resizing and efficient insertion/deletion operations compared to arrays.
5. Commonly used linked list variants include singly linked lists, doubly linked lists, circular linked lists, and more.
